newsitem.title: CANADA: Alberta harvest 85 to 90 percent done.
newsitem.headline: Alberta harvest 85 to 90 percent done.

text.p: Alberta's harvest was 85 to 90 percent done versus 80 percent complete last week, Alberta Agriculture said in a crop report for the week ended Oct 28.

"The Peace River region has about 50 to 55 percent of the crop harvested but in the extreme northern portion of the region the harvest was completed a couple of weeks ago. The Athabasca and Lac La Biche districts have roughly 60 and 50 percent of the crop harvested, respectively," it said.
Ninety percent of crops were havested between Edmonton and Calgary, 80 percent was harvested east of Edmonton.
Southern Alberta completed harvest last week.
Central Alberta had less than 10 percent of crops left to harvest in the west and five to 10 percent of crops left to harvest in the east.
Northeast Alberta reported 85 to 100 percent of crops in the south harvested, while the north had 50 percent of crops in the bin.
Northwest Alberta harvested 80 to 85 percent of its crops in the south, 60 percent of its crop in the north.
The Peace River Valley saw little harvest progress in the past week with 50 to 55 percent of the crop was harvested. Some areas were done harvesting, others had 15 percent done.
